dmRegistration.title: Registration for the German Nationals 2025
dmRegistration.requirements: The registration opens in the beginning of 2025.
dmRegistration.ageDisclaimer: Please note that you must not be older than 22 years in the competition year 2023, i.e., born 01 January 2002 or later.

personalInformation.title: Personal Information
personalInformation.subtitle: The following information is required for registration.

companyInformation.title: Your Company
companyInformation.subtitle: If you work in a company, you can enter it here.

home.title: Welcome to the national centers of software development
home.subtitle: We offer preparation for the world championships!

general.title: General Information
general.subtitle: Who are we and what is our goal?
general.text:
<0>WorldSkills International have made it their mission to increase the attractivity of vocational education. For this purpose, the “world championships of skills“ are held every two years, in which talented, young people compete with each other. The German manifestation of this initiative is <1>WorldSkills Germany, which for example also hosts national and international competitions. In Germany, a National Training Centre belongs to a each skill respectively.

The National Training Centres by WorldSkills Germany have the task of training future members of the German national team and thus participants in international competitions, in addition to training according to WorldSkills principles for as broad a group of participants as possible. They are appointed exclusively only once per skills discipline. The appointment is made by the skills mentors (associations, companies, institutions) together with WorldSkills Germany.

skills.title: Our Skills
skills.text: The Federal Centres of Excellence in Software Development are located at the <0>Albert-Einstein-Gymnasium Neubrandenburg</0>. At this location, <1>Skill 08: Mobile Applications Development</1> and <2>Skill 09: IT Software Solutions for Business</2> are represented. More information on the individual skills can be found on the respective subpages.
skills.skill08: As a software developer with a specialization in mobile applications, you are a programmer and designer in one. You ensure that the apps work on users' mobile devices, look appealing, and are fun to use.
skills.skill09: The skill IT Software Solutions for Business represents the entire spectrum of software-developing IT professions. All full-stack programmers are suitable. This includes desktop, server, database, mobile app and web development.

cta.title: Become part of our national team
cta.subtitle: Have you always wanted to take part in a software development competition and compete with the best of the best? The next registration starts in the beginning of 2025.

general.title: General Information
general.subtitle: Everything you need to know about this Skill

nationalTeam.title: Our national team
nationalTeam.noTeam: There is currently no national team. <0>Register now!</0>

registration.title: Registration
registration.description: <0>You register yourself</0> and receive further information as well as, after the registration is closed, your credentials.

onlineCompetition.title: Online Competition
onlineCompetition.description: During this month, you solve multiple complex tasks at a time of your choosing. Each task takes around 60 – 120 minutes, but you can distribute them across multiple days. The programming language that you use is not relevant.

germanChampionship.title: German Championship
germanChampionship.description: The shared German Championship for both Skills takes place at the National Training Centre in Neubrandenburg. Over four competition days, you will develop complex desktop and Android applications. This determines the joint four- to six-strong national team. Only the following development environments / programming languages can be used:<0><1>Visual Studio (C#) for desktop applications</1><2>Xamarin (C#), Flutter (Dart), and Android Studio (Kotlin or Java) for Android app development</2><3>Microsoft SQL Server</3></0>

einsteinCup.title: Albert Einstein Cup
einsteinCup.description:
The joint national team is being prepared for the following competitions online and in multiple training camps by our trainer team. In February 2024, the Competitors are divided into two separate national teams, one for each Skill.

At the Albert Einstein Cup, both national teams compete against the best software developers of Europe and other continents in their respective Skill. As a result, the two German Competitors for the WorldSkills Lyon 2024 will be determined.

wsc.title: WorldSkills Lyon
wsc.description: In each of the two Skills, one Competitor represents Germany at the WorldSkills in Lyon. The Competition takes place over four days.

08.short: Mobile Applications Developers use technology and design to create apps which are appealing and function well on phones.
08.description:
As a software developer with a specialization in mobile applications, you are a programmer and designer in one. You ensure that the apps work on users' mobile devices, look appealing, and are fun to use.

For the job, you need a certain understanding of technology and design. You need to understand the requirements and wishes of the clients and develop a product that is reliable, updatable, and easy for users to understand and use.
08.requirementsTitle: What experience should you bring with you?
08.requirements: You master at least one programming language, e.g. Dart or Kotlin, and program mobile apps, including the connection to online APIs and the use of integrated sensors. You understand task in English.

occupation.title: A Career with a future and always on the cutting edge
occupation.text:
The possibilities of communication and information exchange are constantly increasing. With a degree in IT, you are in demand: in 2021, about 12 % more IT talents were sought than in the previous year. The Mobile Applications Developer is therefore one of the fastest growing occupations.

Your main working tool is your laptop, so you are almost unrestricted in terms of work location and time, as long as there is no customer appointment. The only thing you need is a stable internet connection.

chancellery2022.title: Federal Chancellery
chancellery2022.text: Justin Konratt receives the “Best of Nation” medal from Chancellor Olaf Scholz.

wsc2022.title: WorldSkills Competition 2022 Special Edition
wsc2022.text: Justin Konratt wins the bronze medal for Germany at the World Championships in Goyang (Korea).

einsteinCup2022.title: Albert Einstein Cup
einsteinCup2022.text: The winners of the Albert Einstein Cup in Neubrandenburg are: Joachim Schiller (Germany), Justin Konratt (Germany), and Kantubhukta Lavanya Sai Kumar (India). Justin Konratt also wins the additional discipline of Speed Programming.

nationalChampionship2023.title: German National Championship
nationalChampionship2023.text: Both skills of the German National Championship are won by Daniel Kalisch, Simon Brebeck, and Nils Jakubzick. Speed Programming is won by Florian Darsow.

einsteinCup2024.title: Albert Einstein Cup
einsteinCup2024.text: Jongwon Kim (South Korea), Daniel Kalisch (Germany), and Wei-Hung Lai (Chinese Taipei) are the winners of the Albert Einstein Cup. Stefan Kornel (Hungary) wins the additional Speed Programming discipline. The “Hungarian Speed Test“ made its first appearance and was won by Nils Jakubzick (Germany).

09.short: Creating new systems and modifying existing ones to provide software solutions to large and small businesses.
09.description:
The skill IT Software Solutions for Business represents the entire spectrum of software-developing IT professions. All full-stack programmers are suitable. This includes desktop, server, database, mobile app and web development.

For this job you need a good technical understanding and logical thinking. You need to understand the requirements and wishes of the client and develop programs that are reliable, updatable, and easy for users to understand and use.
09.requirementsTitle: What experience should you bring with you?
09.requirements: You are proficient in at least one programming language, e.g., C#, can program desktop, server, web, and mobile applications, have knowledge of UML and databases (SQL), and understand English-language tasks.

occupation.title: A Career with a future and always on the cutting edge
occupation.text:
The possibilities for communication and information exchange are constantly increasing. With a degree in IT, you are in demand: In 2021, approximately 12 % more IT talents were sought than in the previous year. As a software developer, you belong to one of the fastest growing occupational groups.

Your main working tool is the computer. This means that you are almost unrestricted in terms of where and when you work, as long as you don't have a customer appointment. The only thing you need is a stable Internet connection.

einsteinCup2022.title: Albert Einstein Cup
einsteinCup2022.text: The winners of the Albert Einstein Cup in Neubrandenburg are: Thomas Gassmann (Switzerland), Glenn Skryzpczak (Germany), and Bence Lakos (Hungary). Justin Konratt wins the additional discipline of Speed Programming.

wsc2022.title: WorldSkills Competition 2022 Special Edition
wsc2022.text: Glenn Skrzypczak becomes the vice world-champion in the additional Speed Programming discipline.

nationalChampionship2023.title: German National Championship
nationalChampionship2023.text: Both skills of the German National Championship are won by Daniel Kalisch, Simon Brebeck, and Nils Jakubzick. Speed Programming is won by Florian Darsow.

euroskills2023.title: EuroSkills Gdańsk 2023
euroskills2023.text: Glenn Skrzypczak achieves a gold medal at the EuroSkills and additionally wins the Speed Programming.

einsteinCup2024.title: Albert Einstein Cup
einsteinCup2024.text: Simon Brebeck (Germany), Lukas Hertkorn (Germany) and Besart Memeti (Switzerland), are the winners of the Albert Einstein Cup. Stefan Kornel (Hungary) wins the additional Speed Programming discipline. The “Hungarian Speed Test“ made its first appearance and was won by Nils Jakubzick (Germany).
